summary:
Expert in Technical Data Management (SubSurface data).
Senior expert in SubSurface Applications Support and Delivery.

Over 35 years of experience in scripting and programming of Unix/Linux applications.
Retrieval and storage of Seismic Data, implemented Seismic Data Management solutions in PDO.
Experience gained with OpenWorks and the several Seismic Interpretations systems used within PDO (and Shell).

Programming languages: Fortran, C, C++, C#. 
Addtional experience with tools as Java, QT, Perl. Oracle DBA, OpenWorks.
Operating systems: UNICOS, ConvexOS, AIX, HP-UX, IRIX, Sun Solaris, RHEL, RHNS, Win7, Win10.

profile_positions.description:
Provide on-location support for animal rescue organisation.
Identify optimum course of action with back-office 
- Pick-up injured or deceased animals and transport to animal shelter or veterinarian specialist
- Assist less mobile citizens to get access to medical care for their pet animals.
profile_positions.title: Animal Ambulance Driver (Volunteer) / Dieren Ambulance Chauffeur (Vrijwilliger)

profile_positions.description: I have taken (early) retirement and enjoying my life after almost 39 years within Shell working at several locations in The Netherlands and Oman.
profile_positions.title: Retired

profile_positions.description:
- Review and follow-up on anomalies in application repository (ServiceNOW)
- Involvement in the I&I CPI activities related to the third party baseload
- Review and follow-up on step-out applications past review date
- Monitor application license usage for opportunities to rationalize and for indications of increased demand
- Assist Portfolio Advisor to develop product and portfolio road-maps based on supplier and product team/product manager input
- Follow-up with business units and SubSurface application support teams on license entitlement issues and application demand changes
- Create, modify, and maintain application objects within the application repository, ensuring compliance with new system rules
- Update and maintain Business Critical and Service Level Management data for applications
- Maintain applications-related records for portfolio, such as step-out documentation
- Assist I&I Portfolio Advisor coordinating the retirement of applications from the portfolio
- Coordinate meetings with C&P, vendors, and finance
- Provide support for Portfolio Advisors around C&P and finance items
- Liaise with PT-SOM and other IT groups on operations activities related to the application portfolio
- Advocate for portfolio standardization on behalf of I&I Portfolio
profile_positions.title: Senior Software License and Business Advisor

profile_positions.description:
- Review and follow-up on anomalies in application repository (APEX)
- Involvement in the SS&W CPI activities related to the third party baseload
- Review and follow-up on step-out applications past review date
- Monitor application license usage for opportunities to rationalize and for indications of increased demand
- Assist Technology Maturation Advisor develop product and portfolio roadmaps based on supplier and product team/product manager input
- Follow-up with business units and SSW application support teams on license entitlement issues and application demand changes
- Create, modify, and maintain application objects within the application repository, ensuring compliance with new system rules
- Update and maintain Business Critical and Service Level Management data for applications
- Maintain applications-related records for portfolio, such as step-out documentation
- Assist Technology Maturation Advisors coordinating the retirement of applications from the portfolio
- Coordinate meetings with C&P, vendors, and finance
- Provide support for Technology maturation Advisors around C&P and finance items
- Liaise with TLS and other IT groups on operations activities related to the application portfolio
- Advocate for portfolio standardization on behalf of SS&W
profile_positions.title: SS&W License and Business Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Coaching/mentoring Young Graduates participating in the Graduate Development Program.
Objectives of the job are:
- Develop approach/strategy to achieve the program set objectives 
- Facilitate the required mentoring for all graduates and to develop effective tactics
- Coaching some Graduates using my technical knowledge in SubSurface applications.
- Managing the program implementation and sustainability
- Introduce fit for purpose methodology on ensure continuous framework enhancements
- Effective strategy on stakeholders engagement
- Development/enhancement of the graduates career/learning ladders
- Assisting on managing the graduates succession planning
profile_positions.title: IM&T Graduate Development Program (GDP) Consultant

profile_positions.description: Implement seismic data management solutions, so that PDO will retain effective seismic data storing, retrieval and usage to support a growing number of end-users and seismic data sets. Specifically for this position, it is important that all seismic data management and integration (link between the several key applications) be fully tested, supported and maintained. The training of new seismic data managers is another important part of the position.
profile_positions.title: Seismic Integration and Data Management Advisor

profile_positions.description: With the introduction of the GAD (Global Application Deployment) services to Logica in Kuala Lumpur, the full responsibility of the Unix/Linux applications deployment is handed over to the team in KL. I was working in the background as consultant for the GAD team until December 2011 and now working on small projects until I have found a new position.
profile_positions.title: Application Deployment Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Exploration & Geophysics Workflow Advisor of the Exploration Interpretation Workspace (EIW) program within Products & Technology (Rijswijk) and UIX NL (The Hague).
Temporary assignment to the Regional Productivity and Support Desk (RPSD) of P&T and UIX NL as 1st line support until a replacement is found for this job.
profile_positions.title: P&T / UIX NL Exploration & Geophysics Workflow Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Working on the succesfull roll-out of the Exploration Interpretation Workspace (EIW) program within Products & Technology (Rijswijk) and UIX NL (The Hague).
Setup the GeoSigns pilot on Linux at PDO. Trained local staff in PDO.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Fully responsible to deploy all available Unix/Linux applications within Shell globally. These Unix/Linux applications are Shell developed and 3rd party software.
Liaise with the Shell development teams and 3rdparty vendors.

The deployment of the Unix/Linux applications globally was done using a FTP-server. Executed a large project within Shell globally to deploy the Unix/Linux applications using RedHat Network Satelite (RHNS) server.
profile_positions.title: Global EP Unix/Linux deployment engineer

profile_positions.description:
Development/Maintenance of the Shell proprietary Seismic Processing package.
During this assignment the Linux OS was introduced as a platform for running the Seismic package. 

To be able to handle large volumes of Seismic data a job generation tool was available. I have started with this team to maintain/extend the functionality of this tool. This tool was using an Oracle database to store seismic tapes with raw data and (pre-)processed data, etc. This tapepool was used to generate large seismic processing jobs.
profile_positions.title: GeoPhysical Application Support

profile_positions.description:
Development/Maintenance of the Shell proprietary Seismic Processing package. 
Developments done on Velocity Modelling using Fortran.
This Seismic Processing package was running on SuperComputers (Cray and Convex) and workstations (IBM RS6000, Sun Solaris, HP Convex) All these machines are running platform specific Unix flavours (UniCOS, ConvexOS, AIX, SunOS, HPUnix, etc.)

Introduced a Configuration Management and Version Control (CMVC from IBM) program for distributing of new releases of the Seismic Processing package and storing new/updated source code. This Configuration Management and Version Control package was using a Oracle database for storing the data. Software was running on IBM's AIX RS6000 machines.

The last years during my assignment, I was responsible for deploying new releases of the Seismic Package to Shell Operating Units globally. I was also member of the so-called "Flying Squad" team, which were responsible for installing and configuring the Seismic processing packages at the OUs locally.
profile_positions.title: GeoPhysical Application Support

profile_positions.description:
Started as Administrative Assistent I was responsible for storing GeoChemical results. During this period got in contact with IT. First major improvement done was automating the storage of GeoChemical data in a database system based on Rapport DBMS.

Sampling of analytical equipment, such as Gaschromatography, automated on a PDP 11/34 system. Results stored as 8-bit data and converted to a VAX/VMS system (16-bits) using DecNet. Automate the storage of this data in the GeoChemical Filing System.

Converted the Rapport database (with the GeoChemical data) to an Oracle DBMS database.
profile_positions.title: GeoChemistry Analyst
